headline: Exclusive-Procter & Gamble to disclose more details about wood-pulp audits, investors say
summary: Procter & Gamble has promised a group of shareholders it will disclose more details about how it audits wood-pulp suppliers, the investors told Reuters, after shareholders pushed the maker of Charmin toilet paper for years to source forest products more sustainably.  Logging's impact on the environment has raised scrutiny of P&G and other major pulp users.  The next step is for P&G and the investors to discuss specifics of what the company will now disclose, said Andrew Shalit, a shareholder advocate at Green Century.
